alert.note: Alert for Adams; Clark; Jackson; Juneau; Monroe; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 4:18PM CST until December 29 at 12:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Accumulating Snow has Shifted Into Wisconsin, but Changing over to Freezing Drizzle... .Snow reports have varied from 2 to as much as 5 inches across much of the area this afternoon. The back edge of the accumulating snowfall is quickly moving to the east and has ended in southeast Minnesota and northeast Iowa. There have been reports of freezing drizzle as the snow leaves the area. In central and western Wisconsin, visibilities will remain poor at times and most roads across the entire region are snow covered and slippery. Expect a slower evening commute. With the lingering freezing precipitation we will extend the advisory a few more hours west of the Mississippi River. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow transitioning to freezing drizzle. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches and a glaze of ice accumulation. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until midnight CST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions check 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Clark; Jackson; Juneau; Monroe; Taylor
